meanings.definition: Cause a great change or improvement in (something)
meanings.sent1: The new technology revolutionises the way we communicate.
meanings.sent2: The invention of the wheel revolutionises transportation.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog revolutionises the world of comedy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile revolutionises the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise revolutionises the dark sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Completely change (something) in a radical way
meanings.sent1: The discovery of fire revolutionises how early humans cooked food.
meanings.sent2: The internet revolutionises how we access information.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a square wheel revolutionises the concept of roundness.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected arrival revolutionises the carefully planned party.
meanings.sent5: The storm revolutionises the calm sea into chaos.
